form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Medical Examination Instructions for Visa Applicants, NARA Form 1023

full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 Chest X-Rays should be obtained from the radiologist recommended by the examining physician. All expenses in connection with medical examinations and X-Rays must be borne by the individual applicant. Applicants will be required to present two copies of the prescribed medical certificate, signed by the appropriate physician, a copy of the laboratory chest X-Ray report and the X-Ray plate to the Consular Officer. Each visa applicant must identify himself to the examining physician and to the radiologist by presentation of his passport and having the physician and radiologist sign the following statements. On May 15, 19 96 I examined the following visa applicant who presented passport No B-781543 as identification. Name of applicant MR ABDUL GHAFOOR KHAN . Dr. Ahmed Raza Jan the Signature Regd. Off Physician Aziz Nursing Home After the same identification I took a chest X-Ray Bawaloind of the above named applicant May 15, 1996 19 Dr. Ahmed Raza Jan Chie M.D B.S. Signature of Radiologist Aziz Nursing Home Rawalpindi (Reports of Medical Examinations will not be accepted by the American Consulate General unless accompanied by the above statements signed by the physician and Radiologist) NOTE: In the IR-5 category children regardless of age may not accompany and should not have their medicals done. Children above 21 years of age except in the F1 and F2B category may not accompany and should not have their medicals done.
